title: Which do you like, front end or back end? Why? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, since the two existing answers said front end, I’ll provide the contrast. I’m a rather asocial introvert with probably a touch of Asperger’s. While I can do front end development, I’d much rather do the back end work. I’m not particularly visual (my dreams are more like someone telling me a story than me watching a movie). That makes it hard for me to create something that is visual; I can do it, but it takes a lot more effort. Now, dealing with the computer and data? That comes easily. I understand how to store and retrieve data, whether in files or a database. I can transform data from one format to another, handle applying equations to it, etc. I understand data structures, I can learn algorithms.

I like being able to manipulate things visually to create a beautiful, readable design. I like putting the extra time into choosing layout, fonts, and flourishes like animations. I prefer front-end for that reason. However, the back-end of a system is tremendously important in terms of the functionality of an actual app/website and I have only respect for back-end developers.
